column2: dummy_df <- data.frame(Organelle = c("Endolysosome", "Golgi Apparatus", "Peroxisome"), PMI = c(NA, NA, NA), performance = c(NA, NA, NA))
ggplot(aes(x = as.factor(PMI), y = performance, group = Organelle, color = Organelle)) + geom_line() +
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Organelle'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
ggsave("Figures/FigS4B_PMI_performance.pdf", plot = PMI, device = "pdf", width = 8.5, height = 4, units = "in", dpi = 300)
